intro: Phlegmariurus treitubensis, commonly known as the Treitubens spleenwort, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is a small, acrocarpous moss that typically grows on rocks or soil in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a dense, cushion-like growth form with closely packed, dark green leaves that are often curved. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on short, upright stalks. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological preferences.
